definition: to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: His shirt ripped at the seam.
What vitamin or what is that split to lack on the side of fingernail?
sentences.chinese: 手指甲旁邊那塊裂開了是缺少什麼維生素還是什麼啊？

sentences.english: The chair-cushion in the corner burst with laughter when she saw it.
sentences.chinese: 牆角里的那個舊椅套子也裂開來看它跳舞。

sentences.english: Old beams began to crack mysteriously.
sentences.chinese: 那些老屋樑神祕地發出裂開的響聲。

sentences.english: The dry seeds ruptures and the green leaf uncurls .
sentences.chinese: 乾燥的種子裂開了，綠色的葉子舒展開來了。

sentences.english: When he bent over, he split his pant .
sentences.chinese: 他一彎腰就把褲襠裂開了。

sentences.english: Hey, Sue. Have you got any pain-killers at hand? I have a splitting headache.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，蘇。你有止疼片嗎？我頭痛的快裂開了。

sentences.english: If they do, the skins will burst, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined.
sentences.chinese: 若是這樣，皮袋就裂開，酒漏出來，連皮袋也壞了。

sentences.english: And God split open the hollow place that is at Lehi, and water came out from it.
sentences.chinese: 神就使利希的窪處裂開，有水從其中湧出來。

sentences.english: The ice on the lake fractured.
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
sentences.chinese: 地裂開，吞下大坍，掩蓋亞比蘭一黨的人。

sentences.english: When that wall cracks, there’s another underneath.
sentences.chinese: 等那層牆壁裂開之後，下面還會有一層牆。

sentences.english: Every time he turns a page, he rips the page.
sentences.chinese: 他每翻一頁，紙張便剝裂開來。

sentences.english: Dehiscent Describing a fruit or fruiting body that opens at maturity to release the seeds or spores.
sentences.chinese: 果實或子實體在成熟時裂開釋放出種子或孢子的現象。

sentences.english: Frog mother is speaking, belly actually pa split.
sentences.chinese: 青蛙媽媽正說着話，肚皮卻啪一聲裂開了。

sentences.english: No wound or muscle dehiscence problems were noted.
sentences.chinese: 未發現切口或肌肉裂開問題。

definition: to break/to sever/to turn off (electric switch)
to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
